intro: Barbarea arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
